Key Match Events: Kolo Muani scored the winning goal for France after a deflection by Jan Vertonghen, causing an own goal for Belgium.
France won three successive games against Belgium, excluding penalty shootouts.
This marked the first Euro round of 16 game where Belgium did not score any goal.
France played seven extra time out of 14 Euro round of 16 games, while Belgium did not play any extra time in Euro games this year.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts favored Real Madrid to win based on their current form.
Pep Guardiola emphasized the importance of controlling midfield possession.
The Messi vs. Ronaldo clash was highlighted as the match's main attraction.
Post-Match Reflections: Erik ten Hag praised his team’s resilience after coming back from 2-0 down.
Chelsea’s manager described the win as a crucial step toward securing a top-four finish.
Luka Modric hinted at retiring from international football after the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Heavy rain delayed the match by 30 minutes.
This marked Arsenal’s first league title since 2004.
This was Barcelona’s 100th El Clásico victory over Real Madrid.
Others: France defender Jules Koundé won the Player of the Match award for his'very strong defense, very helpful for attacking areas, im deliver dangerous crosses and very good one on one defense against Doku.'
